unalcol.types.real

Class DoubleUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.types.real.DoubleUtil

  • public class DoubleUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    Set of constants and methods operating on the primitive double data type, for example, for defining the precision in math operations

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2009

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jonatan Gomez Perdomo

      Precision for considering two double values equivalents

      Determines if two double values are equivalents according to the precision.

    • Method Detail

      • equal

        public static boolean equal(double x,
                            double y)
        Determines if two double values are equivalents according to the precision. Two values are equivalent if abs(x-y) <= precision
        Parameters:
        x - First double value to be compared
        y - Second double value to be compared
        Returns:
        true if abs(x-y) <= precision, false otherwise

      • isZero

        public static boolean isZero(double x)
        Determines if the given double value is zero (according to the precision) or not
        Parameters:
        x - double value to be analized
        Returns:
        true if abs(x) <= precision, false otherwise
